melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਚਾਰੇ ਕੁੰਡਾ ਢੂਢੀਆ ਕੋ ਨੀਮ੍ਹੀ ਮੈਡਾ ॥

translation.text: I have searched in the four directions, but no one is mine.

transliteration.text: chārē kundā dhūdhīā kō nīmhī maidā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਜੇ ਤੁਧੁ ਭਾਵੈ ਸਾਹਿਬਾ ਤੂ ਮੈ ਹਉ ਤੈਡਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: If it pleases You, O Lord Master, then You are mine, and I am Yours. ||1||

transliteration.text: jē tudh bhāvai sāhibā tū mai hau taidā .1.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਦਰੁ ਬੀਭਾ ਮੈ ਨੀਮ੍ਹਿ ਕੋ ਕੈ ਕਰੀ ਸਲਾਮੁ ॥

translation.text: There is no other door for me; where shall I go to worship?

transliteration.text: dar bībhā mai nīmh kō kai karī salām .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਹਿਕੋ ਮੈਡਾ ਤੂ ਧਣੀ ਸਾਚਾ ਮੁਖਿ ਨਾਮੁ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: You are my only Lord; Your True Name is in my mouth. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: hikō maidā tū dhanī sāchā mukh nām .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਸਿਧਾ ਸੇਵਨਿ ਸਿਧ ਪੀਰ ਮਾਗਹਿ ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ॥

translation.text: Some serve the Siddhas, the beings of spiritual perfection, and some serve spiritual teachers; they beg for wealth and miraculous powers.

transliteration.text: sidhā sēvan sidh pīr māgah ridh sidh .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਮੈ ਇਕੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਵੀਸਰੈ ਸਾਚੇ ਗੁਰ ਬੁਧਿ ॥੨॥

translation.text: May I never forget the Naam, the Name of the One Lord. This is the wisdom of the True Guru. ||2||

transliteration.text: mai ik nām n vīsarai sāchē gur budh .2.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਜੋਗੀ ਭੋਗੀ ਕਾਪੜੀ ਕਿਆ ਭਵਹਿ ਦਿਸੰਤਰ ॥

translation.text: Why do the Yogis, the revellers, and the beggars wander in foreign lands?

transliteration.text: jōgī bhōgī kāparī kiā bhavah disantar .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਗੁਰ ਕਾ ਸਬਦੁ ਨ ਚੀਨ੍ਹਹੀ ਤਤੁ ਸਾਰੁ ਨਿਰੰਤਰ ॥੩॥

translation.text: They do not understand the Word of the Guru's Shabad, and the essence of excellence within them. ||3||

transliteration.text: gur kā sabad n chīnhahī tat sār nirantar .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਪੰਡਿਤ ਪਾਧੇ ਜੋਇਸੀ ਨਿਤ ਪੜ੍ਹਹਿ ਪੁਰਾਣਾ ॥

translation.text: The Pandits, the religious scholars, the teachers and astrologers, and those who endlessly read the Puraanas,

transliteration.text: pandit pādhē jōisī nit parhah purānā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਅੰਤਰਿ ਵਸਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਣਨ੍ਹੀ ਘਟਿ ਬ੍ਰਹਮੁ ਲੁਕਾਣਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: do not know what is within; God is hidden deep within them. ||4||

transliteration.text: antar vasat n jānanhī ghat braham lukānā .4.

text: ਇਕਿ ਤਪਸੀ ਬਨ ਮਹਿ ਤਪੁ ਕਰਹਿ ਨਿਤ ਤੀਰਥ ਵਾਸਾ ॥

translation.text: Some penitents perform penance in the forests, and some dwell forever at sacred shrines.

transliteration.text: ik tapasī ban mah tap karah nit tīrath vāsā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਆਪੁ ਨ ਚੀਨਹਿ ਤਾਮਸੀ ਕਾਹੇ ਭਏ ਉਦਾਸਾ ॥੫॥

translation.text: The unenlightened people do not understand themselves - why have they become renunciates? ||5||

transliteration.text: āp n chīnah tāmasī kāhē bhaē udāsā .5.

text: ਇਕਿ ਬਿੰਦੁ ਜਤਨ ਕਰਿ ਰਾਖਦੇ ਸੇ ਜਤੀ ਕਹਾਵਹਿ ॥

translation.text: Some control their sexual energy, and are known as celibates.

transliteration.text: ik bind jatan kar rākhadē sē jatī kahāvah .

text: ਬਿਨੁ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਨ ਛੂਟਹੀ ਭ੍ਰਮਿ ਆਵਹਿ ਜਾਵਹਿ ॥੬॥

translation.text: But without the Guru's Word, they are not saved, and they wander in reincarnation. ||6||

transliteration.text: bin gur sabad n shūtahī bhram āvah jāvah .6.

text: ਇਕਿ ਗਿਰਹੀ ਸੇਵਕ ਸਾਧਿਕਾ ਗੁਰਮਤੀ ਲਾਗੇ ॥

translation.text: Some are householders, servants, and seekers, attached to the Guru's Teachings.

transliteration.text: ik girahī sēvak sādhikā guramatī lāgē .

text: ਨਾਮੁ ਦਾਨੁ ਇਸਨਾਨੁ ਦ੍ਰਿੜੁ ਹਰਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਸੁ ਜਾਗੇ ॥੭॥

translation.text: They hold fast to the Naam, to charity, to cleansing and purification; they remain awake in devotion to the Lord. ||7||

transliteration.text: nām dān isanān drir har bhagat s jāgē .7.

text: ਗੁਰ ਤੇ ਦਰੁ ਘਰੁ ਜਾਣੀਐ ਸੋ ਜਾਇ ਸਿਞਾਣੈ ॥

translation.text: Through the Guru, the Gate of the Lord's Home is found, and that place is recognized.

transliteration.text: gur tē dar ghar jānīai sō jāi siñānai .

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਨਾਮੁ ਨ ਵੀਸਰੈ ਸਾਚੇ ਮਨੁ ਮਾਨੈ ॥੮॥੧੪॥

translation.text: Nanak does not forget the Naam; his mind has surrendered to the True Lord. ||8||14||

transliteration.text: nānak nām n vīsarai sāchē man mānai .8.14.
